conclusion: To find average velocity and speed, understand displacement and distance traveled.
Particle moves along two semicircular arcs from point A to point C.
Each semicircle has a radius of 1m, so the diameter is 2m.
Displacement between A and C is twice the diameter of one semicircle, 4m.
Direction of displacement is from A to C along the horizontal axis.
Each semicircular arc length is half the circumference of a circle with radius 1m.
Circumference of a full circle is 2πR.
Length of one semicircular arc is πR.
Average velocity is displacement divided by time, 0.8 m/s.
Direction of average velocity is from A to C.
Average speed is total distance traveled divided by time, approximately 1.256 m/s.
Final average velocity is 0.8 m/s from A to C.
